intro: Jonesiopsis capillata, commonly known as the slender-stemmed moss, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, creeping growth habit and small, elongated leaves that are often covered in fine, hair-like structures. This plant typically thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its reproductive structures, known as capsules, are borne on short, erect stalks and release spores into the air. Jonesiopsis capillata plays a vital role in nutrient cycling and soil stabilization in its native habitats.
